item.title: Whats your Favorite File Sharing site
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“sinzscapeserver, post:21, topic:354111”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=450403.msg3304770#msg3304770 date=1281579204]

[quote author=sinzscapeserver link=topic=450403.msg3304763#msg3304763 date=1281578921]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=450403.msg3304762#msg3304762 date=1281578836]

I like atomicupload 21Mb/s for me
[/quote]Probably because you own it?

Personally I will never use or trust a one-person owned hosting company, no offense. I don’t see why they would do it without getting anything in return, so I wonder what they are doing that they don’t tell you.

I use my own web server usually.

ive always wanted to own one
[/quote]Why would you want to own file sharing site?

i owned a rsps i want to try something new
[/quote]You still do own one, the advertisement link to it is on the upload page…

EDIT - You lied about how fast it is:

Why did you lie?

thats the server speedtest
plus thats ur speedtest result[/quote]No, it’s someone elses that posted the servers speed on a different site.

PrototypeX:

[quote]I like atomicupload 21Mb/s for me

[quote]You still do own one, the advertisement link to it is on the upload page…

EDIT - You lied about how fast it is:

why did you lie?[/quote]

Dumbass alert?[/quote]Read his thread, he was saying like 100+mbps.

Read full topic

item.source: Whats your Favorite File Sharing site

item.title: Whats your Favorite File Sharing site
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

Primadude:

I prefer Dropbox; I can create my own account, upload as many files as I want (As long as all of them put together are < 2GB) and I can get the direct link for files (Which is good for things such as cache downloading etc).

Exactly the reason I use it, plus you can allow only certain people to download a file, which is nice when working on a server with someone.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats your Favorite File Sharing site
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“justinxg27, post:8, topic:354111”][quote author=Kihomura link=topic=450403.msg3303891#msg3303891 date=1281521687]
Mediafire and Uppit. Though I tend to use Mediafire now because Uppit is flagged by most antiviruses.
[/quote]And you like how fast you can get your files up :)?[/quote]On uppit my average speed is around 1.5mb / s, Mediafire can bring it upto 2.5mb / s or higher, So I’m fine with that. (gf charlieh)

Read full topic

item.title: Whats your Favorite File Sharing site
item.dc:creator: @The_Arcanian The Arcanian
item.description:
@The_Arcanian wrote:

www.Uppit.com

MediaFire

MediaFire

MediaFire is a simple to use free service that lets you put all your photos, documents, music, and video in a single place so you can access them anywhere and share them everywhere.


www.Megashare.com
www.Rapidshare.com
www.YY.lv
www.FileFactory.com
www.FileDropper.com

My most favorite: www.yy.lv (great speed and lot of space)

Read full topic
